body.name: wisecoco No-Cable-Needed Dual-Speaker with OSD 10.1 inch Raspberry Pi LCD Touch Screen Portable Monitor IPS 1024 * 600 HDMI Touchscreen Display for RPi 4B 4 3b+ 3 2 Zero B B+ Windows Drive-Free
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 2 hrs 29 mins
features: 【Specially Designed for Raspberry Pi 】Plug and Play，No driver needed.Especially compatible with Raspberry Pi 4/3/2/1 and support all device equiped with HDMI.The package comes with 4pcs converter connectors,you can easily connect to the display without extra cables if you use for raspberry pi 3/3B 4/4B.

【Real IPS Technology & 178°Full Viewing Angle 】The 10inch touch screen monitor with HD 1024x600 resolution,178°full viewing angle, offers brighter,crisper and clearer images, giving you a truly immersive viewing experience. Tips: In order to get a better image and smooth touch experience, please tear off the screen protector film.

【Computer Secondary Monitor 】Using this as a PC CPU GPU RAM Data Monitor or PC secondary monitor,it will bring you a totally new and wonderful experience. (Tips：Because our product is just a LCD Monitor, so 1, You need to connect your device through the HDMI port to play videos, images, and more. 2, If you need to use Aida64, please download it yourself.)

【Dual Built-In Speakers & Larger Size】Equipped with dual built-in speakers,this lcd display delivers loud and trust sound.Furthermore, wisecoco touch screen monitor features a larger size-10.1'', it will offer you a better user experience.

【Multi-Touch Capabilities】Excellent sensitivity capacitive technology and multi-touch capability allows you to swipe, scroll, select, with a response time 3-5ms . Tips: If the LCD lights up only in the order of red, green, blue and white, it is because the power supply is insufficient, and you need to use a 100w adapter to supply power.(Before that, please make sure the HDMI signal source is correctly connected)

The 10.1" touch screen monitor with HD 1024x600 resolution,178°full viewing angle, offers brighter,crisper and clearer images, giving you a truly immersive viewing experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A good RPi monitor
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I was looking for a monitor for a new Pi v4. I wanted something bigger than the official 7 inch monitor and came across this one. I was as advertised, includes touch screen and came together much easier than the official monitor and case.The kit included hardware to mount a v3 or v4 RPi without running loose cables or manipulating ribbon cables.It was a bit tricky bringing up a new Pi and the monitor at one time. Make sure your power supply can support both the monitor and computer board. During bring up I ended up using separate supplies until it was running smoothly. Over taxed supplies will leave the monitor in a color cycling mode with out attachment to the HDMI signal. Once it was up, I switched to one supply for the whole setup.Good picture quality. It is a bit fragile as it is basically a bare lcd monitor.I would buy another in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Not bad for around $40 when on sale. I had issue getting the touchscreen working on windows but later figured out that it needs to be the main display in order for that to work, would have been nice for secondary display for touchscreen. Overall, good monitor for your projects.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This little screen is amazingly the clearest display I've seen on a raspberrypi
reviews.reviewText: I connected this to a raspberrypi 3 b and wow it's kicking a....s verry good for portable devices this was well worth the tie and money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Was great while it lasted
reviews.reviewText: I bought this about 2 weeks ago and plugged my Raspberry PI into it and it worked right out of the box, the directions are a little sparse but they got the point across. The touch screen was accurate and the color and brightness were perfect for what I was using it for.I was planning to use it as a LCARS display for my smart home assistant, but as I was finishing up the code and ready to test, I turned the monitor and Pi on and there was no display signal, only the screen going through its color change as if nothing was connected... I then plugged it into my computer and still no signal!I'll be returning it, it's within the 30 day return policy but not sure I want to just replace it or get a similar monitor from a different brand...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works like it should
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for my project raspberry pi 4 connected right up also has HDMI input for whatever you desire

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this screen with no failures for a few months now. It is bolted to my toolbox and used as a shop computer in an aviation maintance environment. Its a humid hangar in Florida. So far it has stood up to the abuse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good display, poor documentation
reviews.reviewText: The display works well with my raspberry pi 4 b. The instructions for mechanical connecting the board, power input and mounting legs is sorely lacking.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Difficult to Set up / No Touchscreen Function
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to use with a Raspberry Pi 4. The idea of the monitor is very good. It is a clean installation when you finally get it installed. The instructions are minimal and missing important steps. For example, they do not mention that you need to install stand-offs or the Pi will contact the monitor because the mounting posts are to short. I was also unable to get the device to work unless I installed two power supplies on it, one for the display and one for the Pi. This was in spite of the fact that I was using Official Raspberry Pi supplies per the instructions. Without the two supplies, the monitor would enter a color cycling phase.I was not able to get the touchscreen to work at all. I don't know if it requires a driver. I have not been able to find anywhere to get support. I was looking to use this as a control device for a smart home. It is unfortunate because the looks like it would be a nice solution if it worked.I am probably going to be returning this device and looking for a different solution.
